Package gui

Class MasterUIController

java.lang.Object
gui.MasterUIController
public class MasterUIController
extends java.lang.Object
Handles all direct interaction with the GUI.
Version:
1.22.8
Author:
gscott4
See Also:
Used when the user submits answers, Used when the host begins the game from their GUI

      public MasterUIController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Runs automatically at the start. Initializes instance variables, sets up the choiceBox and leaderboard, starts soundtrack.

    • beginGamePressed

      void beginGamePressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Calls all the handlers addded through addBeginHandler.
      Parameters:
      event - unused

    • submitAnswers

      void submitAnswers​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> answers)
      Calls all the handlers addded through addAnswerHandler.
      Parameters:
      answers - The text of all the answers being submitted. Will only have one item for single-answer questions.

    • button1Pressed

      void button1Pressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

    • button2Pressed

      void button2Pressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

    • button3Pressed

      void button3Pressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

    • button4Pressed

      void button4Pressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

    • answerButtonPressed

      private void answerButtonPressed​(int buttonNum)
      Called when any answerButton is pressed. If currentQuestion is multiple-answer, it toggles the button. If it's single-answer, it calls submitAnswers with the button pressed.
      Parameters:
      buttonNum - the number of the button pressed

    • submitButtonPressed

      void submitButtonPressed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Triggered when the 'submit answers' button is pressed during a multi-answer question. Calls submitAnswers() with the buttons selected.
      Parameters:
      event - unused.

    • addBeginHandler

      public void addBeginHandler​(BeginHandler handler)
      Registers a new BeginHandler to be called when beginGamePressed is called.
      Parameters:
      handler - the handler to be called

    • addAnswerHandler

      public void addAnswerHandler​(AnswerHandler handler)
      Registers a new AnswerHandler to be called when submitAnswers is called.
      Parameters:
      handler - the handler to be called

    • setSide

      public void setSide​(boolean host)
      Sets which side of the connection the GUI should represent. On the client side, locks all serverside-only controls.
      Parameters:
      host - True if host, false if client.

    • loadQuestion

      public void loadQuestion​(Question q) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      Makes all the necessary updates to load a question into the GUI. Changes button text and style, changes question text, loads images if any are needed.
      Parameters:
      q - The question to be loaded.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - If q is null.

    • setActiveTab

      public void setActiveTab​(int tabNum)
      Forces the gui to a certain tab.
      Parameters:
      tabNum - The index of the tab to change to (0, 1, or 2)

    • setActiveTab

      public void setActiveTab​(GameState state)
      Forces the gui to the tab associated with a certain gamestate.
      Parameters:
      state - The state to change gui tab to.

    • setTopicChoices

      public void setTopicChoices​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> choices)
      Sets the options available in the Server view's "select topic" choiceBox.
      Parameters:
      choices - The list of choices to put in the box.

    • setRoster

      public void setRoster​(java.util.ArrayList<Team> roster)
      Populates the roster view with all the teams and players in them currently in the game.
      Parameters:
      roster - List of teams to display.

    • setTeamName

      public void setTeamName​(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the team name in the team display bar.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of current team.

    • setTeamScore

      public void setTeamScore​(int score)
      Sets the team score in the score display bar.
      Parameters:
      score - Score of current team.

    • setTopicDisplay

      public void setTopicDisplay​(java.lang.String topicName)
      Sets the topic in the topic display bar.
      Parameters:
      topicName - Topic of the current quiz.

    • setPlayerName

      public void setPlayerName​(java.lang.String name)
      Deprecated.
      Parameters:
      name - Unused.

    • userNamePopup

      public java.lang.String userNamePopup​(boolean error)
      Creates a popup dialog that prompts the user to enter a username.
      Parameters:
      error - If true, sends the user an additional message that the last-entered username was invalid.
      Returns:
      The name the user entered, or just "username"

    • displayAnswerResult

      public void displayAnswerResult​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> answers, boolean correct)
      Changes the UI to reflect which of the user's submitted answers was correct. If the currentQuestion is single-answer, the last-pressed button will turn green or red depending on whether the submitted answer was right or wrong.
      Parameters:
      answers - The answers the user submitted.
      correct - Whether the answers were right or wrong.

    • runLater

      public void runLater​(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Runs code in the GUI's thread.
      Parameters:
      runnable - Lambda to be run.

    • updateTimerBar

      public void updateTimerBar​(double progress)
      Updates the progressbar at the bottom of the screen.
      Parameters:
      progress - double, 0.0-1.0

    • updateLeaderboard

      public void updateLeaderboard​(java.util.ArrayList<Team> teams)
      Updates the leaderboard chart with Teams' scores
      Parameters:
      teams - List of teams to put on the chart.

    • outOfQuestionsMessage

      public void outOfQuestionsMessage()
      Shows a popup stating there are no questions left.

    • getSelectedTopic

      @Deprecated private java.lang.String getSelectedTopic()
      Deprecated.

      Returns:
      a list of the text on the selected buttons

      Parameters:
      states - Which CSS style to set each
